program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: REAP-MAND RENEW ENERGY SYSTEMS LOANS GUAR
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide permanent financing to Nextgrid Cliffrose LLC to build a 2.494 MWdc ground-mounted solar project located in rural Lewiston, Maine. The project has interconnection and net energy billing agreements in place with Central Maine Power Company, is expected to produce 3,550,000 kilowatt hours (kWh) of electricity in the first full year of operation, and will create three jobs at an average of $30/hour.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: REAP-MAND RENEW ENERGY SYSTEMS LOANS GUAR
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide permanent financing to Nextgrid Mangrove LLC to build a 5.55 MWdc ground-mounted solar project located in rural Lewiston, Maine. The project has interconnection and net energy billing agreements in place with Central Maine Power Company, is expected to produce 7,708,000 kilowatt hours (kWh) of electricity in the first full year of operation, and will create three jobs at an average of $30/hour.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: REAP-MAND RENEW ENERGY SYSTEMS LOANS GUAR
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide permanent financing to Nextgrid Peppertree, LLC to build a 5.56 MWdc ground-mounted solar project located in rural Poland, Maine. The project has interconnection and net energy billing agreements in place with Central Maine Power Company and is expected to produce 7,560,000 kilowatt hours of electricity in the first full year of operation.

naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide business based training and technical assistance to rural microborrowers and potential microborrowers throughout Androscoggin, Franklin, and Oxford Counties. Technical assistance is an essential part of the microlending process. It often makes the difference between the success or failure of a new business, affecting the ability of the microborrower to repay its debt in a timely fashion.

project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide a wide range of technical assistance to towns and/or groups of towns operating together in the three-county region of Androscoggin, Franklin, and Oxford. The goal is to reduce the amount of toxicity of waste being disposed and continue to improve the sustainability of the local and regional solid waste systems. In accomplishing this goal, Androscoggin Valley Council of Governments will work with communities to improve efficiencies, reduce costs where possible, protect the environment and public health, increase institutional capacity and compliance, and ensure adequate facilities for now and the future.

project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase snowmobile trail grooming equipment which will replace an old and maintenance heavy trail groomer. This equipment is vital to the winter economy and ensures continued access to businesses during the winter months. The City of Caribou will assist 21 business and save a total of 15 full-time equivalent jobs. The total project cost $254,253

This project is expected to save $56,956 per year and produce 478,748 kilowatt hours (100 percent of the farm energy use) per year, which is enough energy to power 44 homes.Irving Farms, Inc. grow, handle and pack all sizes of White, Russet, Red, and Yellow potatoes for the fresh market, and distribute and market processing potatoes and all varieties of Foundation and Certified Seed & Grain from Maine and other Eastern growing origins.

naics_industry_sector: Retail Trade (44-45)
naics_description: SUPERMARKETS AND OTHER GROCERY (EXCEPT CONVENIENCE) STORES
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Best For Less, Inc dba Save-A-Lot, located in Caribou, Aroostook County, Maine, install a solar photovoltaic system.Save-A-Lot is a discount grocery store with low prices on fresh fruit, veggies, quality meats and carefully selected grocery items. This project is expected to save $53,296 per year and produce 427,777 kilowatt hours (73 percent of the business energy use) per year, which is enough energy to power 39 homes.

naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to support the development and ongoing success of microentrepreneurs and microenterprises in Aroostook county and Washington county, Maine. This loan will capitalize a revolving loan fund that will allow Northern Maine Development Commission to provide fixed-interest rate microloans to rural businesses.

naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide business based training and technical assistance to rural microborrowers and potential microborrowers throughout Aroostook and Washington Counties. Technical assistance is an essential part of the microlending process. It often makes the difference between the success or failure of a new business, affecting the ability of the microborrower to repay its debt in a timely fashion.

naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide business based training and technical assistance to rural microborrowers and potential microborrowers throughout Aroostook and Washington Counties. borrower_name: THE CENTER FOR THE ADVANCEMENT OF RURAL LIVING
naics_industry_sector: Health Care and Social Assistance (62)
naics_description: RESIDENTIAL INTELLECTUAL AND DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITY FACILITIES
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase and rehabilitate a facility to be used as a Womens Recovery Home as well as another facility to serve as the Mens Recovery House. The Center for the Advancement of Rural Living is a non-profit corporation with a mission to provide a continuum of services for populations in need in Aroostook County. The services include a residence for individuals coming to terms with alcohol and substance abuse recovery as they work to transition back into the community. They will provide opportunities for meetings, peer counseling, educational materials, job training and mentoring/support from the live-in managers.

naics_industry_sector: Arts, Entertainment, and Recreation (71)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to replace an informational road sign with a new digital sign for the Southern Aroostook Agricultural Museum (SAAM) in Littleton, Maine, located on the main road visible to all passerbys. Along with operating a museum, there is an agricultural barn, a transportation/snow removal barn, a barrel making shop and a blacksmiths shop. They are open for tours, public suppers and conferences. This is the only facility of its kind in Southern Aroostook County. This Museum also serves as an emergency facility for the area. The sign will increase visibility of museum events, community events and emergency alerts.

borrower_name: THE CENTER FOR THE ADVANCEMENT OF RURAL LIVING
naics_industry_sector: Health Care and Social Assistance (62)
naics_description: RESIDENTIAL INTELLECTUAL AND DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITY FACILITIES
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase and rehabilitate a facility to be used as a Womens Recovery Home as well as another facility to serve as the Mens Recovery House. The Center for the Advancement of Rural Living is a non-profit corporation with a mission to provide a continuum of services for populations in need in Aroostook County. The services include a residence for individuals coming to terms with alcohol and substance abuse recovery as they work to transition back into the community. They will provide opportunities for meetings, peer counseling, educational materials, job training and mentoring/support from the live-in managers.

borrower_name: THE WELL OF MARS HILL MAINE
naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to complete minor renovations to an afterschool childrens center in Mars Hill, Maine. The repairs will include new flooring, updating the electrical, painting the interior, new lighting and replacing doors. The Well of Mars Hill Maine offers after-school and evening programs, tutoring, mentoring, real-life classes, internet access, educational and cultural programs. They will also remain open during school vacations to provide a safe environment for youth along with free drinks, snacks and a meal.

naics_industry_sector: Arts, Entertainment, and Recreation (71)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to renovate a one-room schoolhouse called the Longfellow School that dates back to the 1920s to 1940s. This is the last remaining one-room schoolhouse in the area. The renovations include windows, ceiling and flooring repairs, entrance area and rebuild the storage/outhouse facility attached behind the building. The hardwood flooring was saved from the Our Lady of Peace hall which was part of the Daughters of Wisdoms Boarding School dating back to the early 1960s. The Longfellow School is a meaningful addition to the historical societys site. It will provide a gathering place for visitors and local residents to view and interpret the history of the one-room schoolhouses that served the surrounding communities from that era.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: REAP-MAND RENEW ENERGY SYSTEMS LOANS GUAR
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide Pequawket Trail Baldwin Solar, LLC the funds to refinance a short-term loan used to build a 6.835 MWdc ground-mounted solar project located in rural Baldwin Maine. In addition to this Rural Energy for America Program (REAP) guaranteed Loan, the project will be financed by a borrower contribution of $187,483 and a tax equity investment of $6,200,000. The project has interconnection and net energy billing agreements in place with Central Maine Power Company and is expected to produce 8,404,000 kWh of electricity in the first full year of operation, and will create three jobs at an average of $30/hour.

naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to construct a Educational/Training Facility (known as the Smith Center for Education and Research) which will provide with the space, efficiencies, and logistics necessary to meet the organizations and clients needs. Wolfes Neck Farm Foundation was established in 1997 as a small non-profit organization for the purpose of engaging in charitable, educational, and scientific activities related to alternative farming techniques, conservation management, research, education, and public stewardship.Wolfes Neck Farm is a one-of-a-kind place on the coast of Maine that connects farmers, eaters, and learners to the land and animals at the core of our food systems, while also being stewards of the land. The Smith Center will enable the organization to expand upon a crucial need for education and research initiatives/development, as well as further the role of convener around topics related to their growing body of work. The new facility will enable Wolfes Neck Farm to increase their indoor workshops/seminars/camp meetings from a maximum of 18 participants to upwards of 150. The proposed facility will also provided a needed heated indoor growing space, a teaching kitchen, classroom space, dining area, and a small year-round retail space.

Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to upgrade the wastewater collection system in the town of Verona Island. The current equipment has outlived its useful life so upgrades must be made in order to reduce safety concerns with the operators. The project involves replacing of the Admiral Peary Lane Pump Station with a wet well mounted station and for the East Side Drive Pump Station to have its all components replaced. The project also includes rehabilitation of approximately 16 manholes that are contributing excess flows through leaking hinged covers or through deteriorated brick and mortar riser sections. The towns collection system was constructed in 1985 and consists of about 5,100 linear feet ofPolyvinyl chloride gravity sewer pipe, about 25 concrete manholes, and two pump stations. The collection system conveys wastewater to the neighboring town of Bucksports wastewater treatment facility for treatment before discharge to the Penobscot River.

The towns collection system was constructed in 1985 and consists of about 5,100 linear feet ofPolyvinyl chloride gravity sewer pipe, about 25 concrete manholes, and two pump stations. program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: REAP-MAND RENEW ENERGY SYSTEMS LOANS GUAR
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide Route 32 China Solar LLC the funds to refinance a short-term loan used to build a 7.35 MWdc ground-mounted solar project located in rural China Maine. In addition to this Rural Energy for America Program (REAP) guaranteed Loan, the project will be financed by a borrower contribution of $593,382 and a tax equity investment of $6,000,000. The project has interconnection and net energy billing agreements in place with Central Maine Power Company, is expected to produce 9,185,000 kWh of electricity in the first full year of operation, and will create three jobs at an average of $30/hour.

funding_code: REAP-MAND RENEW ENERGY SYSTEMS LOANS GUAR
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide permanent financing to Nextgrid Mastic, LLC to build a 5.033 MWdc ground-mounted solar project located in rural Waterville, Maine. In addition to this loan, the project will be financed by a borrower contribution of $1,397,361 and a tax equity investment of $3,425,534. The project has interconnection and net energy billing agreements in place with Central Maine Power Company, is expected to produce 6,710,000 kWh of electricity in the first full year of operation, and will create three jobs at an average of $30/hour.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: MAND. RENEW ENERFY SYSTEMS GRANTS UNDER $20,000
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will beused to purchase and install a 21.12 kW ground-mounted solar PV system. This project will replace 22,978 kWh (100 percent) of business energy usage and realize $1,814 of savings annually.The purpose of this funding program is to assist farmers, ranchers, and rural small businesses in developing renewable energy systems, and in making energy-efficiency improvements to its operations.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: REAP-MAND RENEW ENERGY SYSTEMS LOANS GUAR
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide Enterprise Avenue Gardiner Solar, LLC the funds to refinance a short-term loan used to build a 1.3 MWdc roof-mounted solar project located in rural Gardiner, Maine. In addition to this Rural Energy for America Program (REAP) guaranteed Loan, the project will be financed by a borrower contribution of $59,132 and a tax equity investment of $1,100,000. The project has interconnection and net energy billing agreements in place with Central Maine Power Company and is expected to produce 1,474,000 kWh of electricity in the first full year of operation, and will create three jobs at an average of $30/hour.

funding_code: LOCAL AGRICULTURE MARKET RESOURCE PROGRAM (LAMP) VALUE-ADDED PRODUCER GRANTS - COVID
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist agricultural producers seeking to establish or expand markets for their value-added agricultural products. Olde Haven Farm, LLC will use the working capital grant funds to expand productions, marketing, and sales of pork and lamb sausages, canned pickles, and preserves. This project will allow for an increase in customer base and revenue and will add two full time jobs.

project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help EDooryard Farm, LLC install a new solar photovoltaic system. This is a certified organic farm that grows vegetables and pasture-raised animals which they sell in and around Camden, Maine. This project is expected to save $1,603 per year. It will generate 28,718 kilowatt hours per year, which is enough to power two homes.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: MAND. RENEW ENERFY SYSTEMS GRANTS UNDER $20,000
naics_industry_sector: Manufacturing (31-33)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase and install a 20.15 kW roof-mounted solar PV system. This project will replace 21,200 kWh(37 percent) of business energy usage and realize $1,667 of savings annually.The purpose of this funding program is to assist farmers, ranchers, and rural small businesses in developing renewable energy systems, and in making energy-efficiency improvements to its operations.

funding_code: LAMP BEGINNING AND SOCIALLY DISADVANTAGED FARMERS OR RANCHERS RESERVE MANDATORY
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Gwendolyn E Brodis, d/b/a Brodis Wile Blueberries, assess the feasibility of making and selling value-added blueberry products in the Mid-Coast Maine region. The study intends to find which value-added products in their current line are more and less feasible based on market needs and potential profitability.

project_name: FY21 VAPG WC GOAT MILK SOAP
funding_code: LAMP BEGINNING AND SOCIALLY DISADVANTAGED FARMERS OR RANCHERS GRANTS - COVID
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist agricultural producers seeking to establish or expand markets for their value-added agricultural products. Wandering Goat, LLC will use the working capital funds expand productions, marketing, and sales of goat milk soap. This project will allow for an increase in customer base and revenue and will add two part-time jobs.

funding_code: RCDI RURAL COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT INITIATIVE GRANT
naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Island Institute continue its fellowship program in five low-income communities to build capacity to perform economic and community development activities. In the city of Eastport, the fellowship program will help with the need for more energy efficient elderly housing and to support local efforts to expand access to affordable broadband. In the town of Beals, the fellowship program will help the Downeast Institute provide marine science education to support the local shellfish industry and fishery to develop sustainable practices.In the town of Machias, the fellowship program will help Sunrise County Economic Council to support the creation of jobs and prosperity in Washington County, the poorest county in Maine.In the town of Sullivan, the fellowship program will help Sullivan-Sorrento Historical Society preserve the natural and cultural history of this coastal region to make it available to locals and visitors.In the town of Vinalhaven, the fellowship program will help with strategic and capital improvement plans with committees focusing on affordable housing, sea level rise, broadband, update the GIS database on infrastructure needs, and assist with the annual town report.

project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used rehabilitate and make immediate upgrades the city of Rocklands wastewater treatment facility. Some of the plants original equipment and processes are upwards of forty years old, and the overall facility is well beyond its twenty-year useful life. The proposed upgrades will help the system operate more effectively and efficiently and address the Maine Department of Environmental Protections health and sanitary concerns. The upgrades included in this project represent the highest priorities identified in the citys Strategic Plan and Combined Sewer Overflow Master Plan and will have the greatest benefit to the distribution system. The proposed project is in an Agency identified target area. The proposed project will not only correct the plants current operating deficiencies, but also help the city improve their economic development opportunities.

naics_industry_sector: Manufacturing (31-33)

This project is expected to save $2,200 per year. It will replace 16,542 kilowatt hours (100 percent of the companys energy use) per year, which is enough energy to power one home.

This project is expected to save $3,100 per year and generate 28,626 kilowatt hours per year, which is enough energy to power two homes.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
borrower_name: NORTH NOBLEBORO ROAD WALDOBORO SOLAR, LL
funding_code: REAP-MAND RENEW ENERGY SYSTEMS LOANS GUAR
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide North Nobleboro Road Waldoboro Solar, LLC the funds to refinance a short-term loan used to build a 3.34 MWdc ground-mounted solar project located in rural Waldoboro, Maine. In addition to this Rural Energy for America Program (REAP) guaranteed loan, the project will be financed by a borrower contribution of $539,708 and a tax equity investment of $2,100,000. The project has interconnection and net energy billing agreements in place with Central Maine Power Company. It is expected to produce 4,131,000 kWh of electricity in the first full year of operation, and will create three jobs at an average of $30/hour.

This project will allow for an increase in customer base and revenue and will add three part-time employees.

project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase teleconferencing equipment to connect 16 schools, including public schools and special-purpose private schools, in seven counties in rural Maine. The schools will use the equipment to access professional development and Science, Technology, Engineering and Math (STEM) activities. It also will provide more reliable communication for students at home due to the pandemic.

naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase video-telecommunications hardware, software and integrated-classroom presentation equipment to support distance learning among 21 schools in Aroostook County, Maine. The project will help to expand curricula in Science, Technology, Engineering and Math (STEM); foreign language and other subjects by providing access to educational opportunities across the school districts and dual enrollment to University of Maine Presque Isle. Funds also will be used to purchase personal devices, remote access points and web conferencing licenses to help students participate in classroom activities from home. Teachers will have remote access to professional development, coaching and mentoring opportunities.

naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to bring Medical Care Development, Harvard Pilgrim HealthCare, Aroostook Mental Health Services (AMHC), and the National Digital Equity Center together, and partner to improve access to telehealth, specifically in Aroostook and Washington counties, with the primary focus being to treat individuals who live in these two counties that suffer from substance and opiod use disorder.

naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to expand the Sanford School Departments middle school aquaponics program into a district-wide Science, Technology, Engineering and Math (STEM) education program. It will enable Kittery students and others to access STEM-related career training from the Sanford CTE center. The project will provide a more flexible approach to teacher professional development. It also to keep the schools open in hybrid learning during the remainder of the pandemic.

naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to support the Unity College Hyflex Classroom Project, which is an initiative of the colleges newest sustainable education business unit (the Technical Institute for Environmental Professions). Students will have opportunities to build in-demand professional skills and earn Associates degrees, or professional certifications. The project will help integrate virtual reality technology and help students in rural areas interact with diverse colleagues all across the globe.

naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to develop and connect the University of Maines Aquaculture Teaching Lab to K-12 schools, a community college and technical training centers throughout the state of Maine. It will also establish a distance learning connection with the University of Maines main campus. The lab is located at the Center for Cooperative Aquaculture Research in Franklin, Maine. Funds will enable the center to purchase video telecommunications hardware, software, and related equipment, as well as outfitting the lab with state-of-the-art sensors and controls allowing students to remotely access and interact with the lab expanding the reach of UMaines aquaculture programming.

naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to install interactive video-teleconferencing equipment at 42 locations across 11 Maine counties. The project will expand educational opportunities for students at remote rural centers and campuses, and help medical clinics expand access to telehealth services for rural patients.

naics_industry_sector: Arts, Entertainment, and Recreation (71)
naics_description: ALL OTHER AMUSEMENT AND RECREATION INDUSTRIES
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase an alpine trail grooming equipment that will replace an old and maintenance heavy groomer. Black Mountain of Maine is vital to Rumfords winter economy and plays a major role in its economic development. The mountains historic reputation and skier events are vital to Rumford being able to attract a new Best Western Hotel to the area. Black Mountain of Maine will assist 9 businesses. The total project cost $78,000.

borrower_name: RUMFORD POLAR BEARS SNOWMOBILE CLUB INC
naics_industry_sector: Arts, Entertainment, and Recreation (71)
naics_description: ALL OTHER AMUSEMENT AND RECREATION INDUSTRIES
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase snowmobile trail grooming equipment. This equipment will replace an old and maintenance heavy trail groomer. This equipment is vital to the winter economy and ensures continued access to businesses during the winter months. The Rumford Polar Bear Snowmobile Club will assist 21 business and save a total of 9 full-time equivalent jobs.

Technical assistance is an essential part of the microlending process. It often makes the difference between the success or failure of a new business, affecting the ability of the microborrower to repay its debt in a timely fashion.

Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to improve the facilities that serve the high-pressure zone along the Harlow Hill Road and Backkingdom Road, as well as several other streets in Mexico, Maine. The facilities that serve this area include the Backkingdom standpipe, the Harlow Hill booster pump station, two pressure reducing valves, and distribution piping. The Mexico Water District will be replacing a welded steel water storage tank with a cast in place concrete reservoir, completing improvements to the Harlow Hill booster pump station, upgrading the two pressure reducing valves, and replacing the water main that is a 100-year old unlined cast iron pipe that has outlived its useful life. These upgrades will maintain and improve the level of service provided to this area and will also increase the dependability of the system.

project_name: FY 2021 Main WWTF/ Dix Ave PS and FY 2019 PPG
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide financial assistance for comprehensive upgrades to the main wastewater treatment facility and the Dix Avenue Pump Station. The project at the main wastewater treatment facility includes replacing the screen, bar rack, grit removal system, septage receiving offloading area, channel, and bar rack, raw sewage piping system, mechanical aerators, secondary clarifier mechanisms, and covers, submersible pumps, sodium hypochlorite and sodium bisulfite storage and feed systems, sludge blowers, aeration piping, diffuser system, belt filter press, plant water system, heating ventilating air conditioning (HVAC) system, plumbing system, instrumentation and controls, and electrical system. This project will rehabilitate all concrete channels and tanks, and also includes demolishing the two trickling filters. The upgrades to the Dix Ave Pump Station includes demolishing the grit system and replacing the influent sluice gate and hydraulic power pack, comminutor, all field instruments, pumps, piping, valves, HVAC system, electrical system, roof membrane, and facia. The upgrades include relocating the Electrical/Control Room, and control system. These upgrades will maintain and improve the level of service provided to this area and will also increase the dependability of the system.

project_name: FY 2021 Main WWTF/ Dix Ave PS and FY 2019 PPG
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide financial assistance for comprehensive upgrades to the main wastewater treatment facility and the Dix Avenue Pump Station. The project at the main wastewater treatment facility includes replacing the screen, bar rack, grit removal system, septage receiving offloading area, channel, and bar rack, raw sewage piping system, mechanical aerators, secondary clarifier mechanisms, and covers, submersible pumps, sodium hypochlorite and sodium bisulfite storage and feed systems, sludge blowers, aeration piping, diffuser system, belt filter press, plant water system, heating ventilating air conditioning (HVAC) system, plumbing system, instrumentation and controls, and electrical system. This project will rehabilitate all concrete channels and tanks, and also includes demolishing the two trickling filters. The upgrades to the Dix Ave Pump Station includes demolishing the grit system and replacing the influent sluice gate and hydraulic power pack, comminutor, all field instruments, pumps, piping, valves, HVAC system, electrical system, roof membrane, and facia. The upgrades include relocating the Electrical/Control Room, and control system. These upgrades will maintain and improve the level of service provided to this area and will also increase the dependability of the system.

naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Eastern Maine Development Corporation conduct a feasibility study for a meat slaughter and processing facility. This assistance will ultimately benefit the farmers and independent producers that are members of Perseco, LLC. The total project cost is $42,686.

naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Four Directions Development Corporation provide one-on-one, on-reservation, technical assistance. This assistance will be available to Native American business owners, both existing and start-up, across Maine. Four Directions Development Corporations will assist 12 businesses and help create a total of 15 jobs. The total project cost is $202,000.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Keith Miller, dba Green Valle Farm, a dairy farm in Newburgh, Maine, install a new solar photovoltaic system. This project is expected to save $15,931 per year and replace 111,390 kilowatt hours (72 percent of the farm energy use) per year, which is enough energy to power 10 homes.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: MAND. RENEW ENERFY SYSTEMS GRANTS UNDER $20,000
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
naics_description: OTHER VEGETABLE (EXCEPT POTATO) AND MELON FARMING
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be usedto purchase and install a 8.0 kW roof-mounted solar PV system. This project will replace 9,333 kWh (100 percent) of business energy usage and realize $844 of savings annually.The purpose of this funding program is to assist farmers, ranchers, and rural small businesses in developing renewable energy systems, and in making energy-efficiency improvements toits operations.

naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide business based training and technical assistance to rural microborrowers and potential microborrowers throughout Hancock, Penobscot, and Piscataquis Counties, as well as portions of Waldo County. Technical assistance is an essential part of the microlending process. It often makes the difference between the success or failure of a new business, affecting the ability of the microborrower to repay its debt in a timely fashion.

borrower_name: YOUNG MEN'S CHRISTIAN ASSOCIATION OF OLD TOWN AND ORONO
naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
naics_description: OTHER PUBLIC BUILDING & IMPROVEMENT RELATED SERVICES
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to replace the current fire alarm system. The fire alarm system has been added on to, extended, and repaired beyond its capabilities. It is imperative that this facility has a reliable and functioning fire alarm system that meets current Fire and Life Safety Codes as adopted by the State of Maine and the city of Old Town. This will ensure the notification and timely evacuation of the occupants of the facility. The Young Mens Christian Association of Old Town and Orono is located in the city of Old Town and serves the surrounding communities: Milford, Orono, Bradley, Alton, Bangor, Greenbush, Penobscot Island Reservation, and Brewer. This facility offers many opportunities for area communities. It houses a Field House for gymnastic and indoor track and field events. The facility also offers a therapeutic swimming pool, fully equipped fitness center, a basketball court, two racket ball courts, and indoor batting cage.

project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to upgrade the vehicle fleet and firefighter safety equipment. The town will purchase a slightly used ladder truck, a new fire engine, and 17 breathing apparatus units. The fire department covers a 4,377 square mile area and responds to over 300 calls annually. The new equipment is essential to protecting the citizens of Dover-Foxcroft and surrounding communities.

naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to renovate Center Theatre located in the town of Dover-Foxcroft, Maine. Center Theatre is the only professional performing arts venue in Piscataquis County. As such, it is a major resource for the schools and community. Many of its programs focus on children and education including drama camps, after school program, childrens theatrical productions, and educational programs in cooperation with Foxcroft Academy. The theater also produces a number of live theatrical productions during the year as well as host concerts, meetings, and community events. Another component of the Theatres programming is first and second-run movies along with documentaries and art films. Grant funds will be used for the rehabilitation of the columns and footings supporting the theater over the banks of the Piscataquis River. The theater is a historic building and over time there has been damage caused by flooding, ice and erosion. Damage has also been caused by improper roof drainage which will be corrected as part of this project. The project is needed for the preservation of this important community asset.

project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to expand the Harmony Cares Food Pantry located in the Town of Harmony, Maine. The food pantry also serves the neighboring towns of Cambridge and Wellington. Since the opening of the pantry in 2017, the number of food insecure families served by this facility has tripled. Additional food distribution/storage space and refrigeration/freezer capacity is desperately needed to meet the growing demand. This project involves the construction of a 28x30 footaddition that will provide the space needed for food distribution, storage, and a restroom. The project also will provide existing facility upgrades, an emergency generator, and commercial refrigeration/freezer units.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: REAP-MAND RENEW ENERGY SYSTEMS LOANS GUAR
naics_industry_sector: Manufacturing (31-33)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide permanent financing to FSS Inc. and POAFTROL, LLC to build a 452.45 kilowatt dc ground-mounted solar project located in rural Belfast, Maine. In addition to this Rural Development loan, the project will be financed by a borrower contribution of $107,859 and a non-guaranteed loan of $122,266. The project has interconnection and net energy billing agreements in place with Central Maine Power Company and is expected to produce 407,798 kilowatt hours of electricity in the first full year of operation.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: REAP-MAND RENEW ENERGY SYSTEMS LOANS GUAR
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide Perkins Road Belfast Solar LLC the funds to refinance a short-term loan used to build a 7.0 MWdc ground-mounted solar project located in rural Belfast Maine. In addition to this Rural Energy for America Program (REAP) guaranteed Loan, the project will be financed by a borrower contribution of $120,065 and a tax equity investment of $6,400,000. The project has interconnection and net energy billing agreements in place with Central Maine Power Company, is expected to produce 8,829,000 kWh of electricity in the first full year of operation, and will create three jobs at an average of $30/hour.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants

project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Savorys, dba Belfast Harbor Inn, a hotel in coastal Belfast, Maine, install a new solar photovoltaic system. This project is expected to save $14,707 per year and replace 119,740 kilowatt hours (68 percent of the business energy use) per year, which is enough energy to power 11 homes.

Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to upgrade the town of Searsports wastewater treatment facility from a primary treatment facility to a secondary treatment facility with tertiary treatment for disinfection. The investment will also be used for upgrades to all eight of the towns pump stations. New conventional activated sludge aeration tanks will be constructed to provide secondary treatment.

naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to upgrade the town of Searsports wastewater treatment facility from a primary treatment facility to a secondary treatment facility with tertiary treatment for disinfection. The investment will also be used for upgrades to all eight of the towns pump stations. New conventional activated sludge aeration tanks will be constructed to provide secondary treatment.

naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase furniture and other equipment for the Machias Valley Center for Entrepreneurship. The center will have shared working space, open co-working stations, shared office equipment, a kitchen area and offer training and programming activities for small businesses. Sunrise County Economic County will assistseven business and create a total oftwo full-time equivalent jobs. The total project cost $53,538.

naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to support the development and ongoing success of microentrepreneurs and microenterprises in Washington County, Maine. This loan will capitalize a revolving loan fund that will allow the Sunrise County Economic Council to provide fixed-interest rate microloans to rural businesses.

naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide business based training and technical assistance to rural microborrowers and potential microborrowers throughout Washington County. Technical assistance is an essential part of the microlending process. It often makes the difference between the success or failure of a new business, affecting the ability of the microborrower to repay its debt in a timely fashion.

funding_code: LAMP VALUE ADDED PRODUCER GRANT MANDATORY
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Mark Jacoby, d/b/a Blue Barrens Farm expand production and distribution of fresh-packed and fresh-frozen wild Maine blueberries.

funding_code: LOCAL AGRICULTURE MARKET RESOURCE PROGRAM (LAMP) VALUE-ADDED PRODUCER GRANTS - COVID
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
naics_description: BROILERS AND OTHER MEAT TYPE CHICKEN PRODUCTION
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist agricultural producers seeking to establish or expand markets for their value-added agricultural products. Tide Mill Organics will use the working capital grant funds to expand productions, marketing, and sales of organic chicken and sausage to out of state markets. This project will allow for an increase in customer base and revenue and will add four full time jobs.

funding_code: LAMP VALUE ADDED PRODUCER GRANT MANDATORY
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Passamaquoddy Maple expand its current grocery and specialty food outlets. Passamaquoddy Maple is a tribal enterprise of the Passamaquoddy Tribe at Indian Township

naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to replace the deteriorated roof shingles with a metal roof system at the East Machias facility. In addition to roof replacement, the flashing, trim, soffits, ridge vent and cap, fascia bird wire protection and other supporting appurtenances will be replaced. This facility operates a conservation fish hatchery and administrative offices. The Downeast Salmon Federation through a formal partnership with the US Fish and Wildlife Service, rears endangered Atlantic salmon from egg stage to parr stage and releases fish into the waters of the East Machias river on an annual basis.

naics_industry_sector: Information (51)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to replace and repoint nearly 1,000 square feet of brick on the Peavey Memorial Library in Eastport, Maine. Over the past few decades, the masonry faade, roof and cupola have suffered significant deterioration and completing these repairs will ensure the library is preserved and available to support and serve future generations. Since 1893, the library has been providing a gathering space for residents, visitors, and researchers. It is the learning center of the community offering educational and cultural services, a balanced collection of books and other materials, and free public internet access seven days a week, year-round. Designated in 1982, the library was included among 29 other structures of the Eastport Historic District of late 19 th Century and early 20th Century structures.

project_name: FY2021 WWTF and Pump Station Upgrades
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to upgrade the existing wastewater treatment facility and four pump stations. These systems have reached well beyond their useful design life and now require these upgrades to prevent system malfunctions and environmental hazards. Improvements to the pump stations will help replace the pumps and install control panels, telemetry and rail retrieval systems. Improvements to the wastewater treatment plant will help install a properly ventilated and readily accessible headworks vault for safe access to the grinder ahead of the pumps, an influent grinder and bypass bar screen, an influent sampler and a chlorine pump. The funds will be used to retrofit the Imhoff tank internal components, make general building repairs, upgrade the telemetry and alarm systems and replace process water pump and critical laboratory equipment.

Improvements to the wastewater treatment plant will help install a properly ventilated and readily accessible headworks vault for safe access to the grinder ahead of the pumps, an influent grinder and bypass bar screen, an influent sampler and a chlorine pump. The funds will be used to retrofit the Imhoff tank internal components, make general building repairs, upgrade the telemetry and alarm systems and replace process water pump and critical laboratory equipment.

These audits will provide analysis to make energy-efficiency improvements to these operations.

naics_industry_sector: Arts, Entertainment, and Recreation (71)
naics_description: ALL OTHER AMUSEMENT AND RECREATION INDUSTRIES
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase and install a 27.3 kW roof-mounted solar PV system. This project will replace 31,382 kWh (over 100%) of business energy usage and realize $2,842 of savings annually.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: MAND. RENEW ENERFY SYSTEMS GRANTS UNDER $20,000
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
naics_description: FRUIT AND TREE NUT COMBINATION FARMING
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Poor Richards Incorporated, dba Ferment Farm install a solar photovoltaic system. This farm specializes in heritage produce used to produce premium micro-batch foods including ice cream, fermented foods, and cider in Springvale, Maine. This project is expected to save $1,018 per year and generate 7,100 kilowatt hours per year.

naics_industry_sector: Health Care and Social Assistance (62)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist the town of Old Orchard Beach, Maine to acquire a new ambulance and lifesaving/safety equipment. With the town of Old Orchard Beach being a summertime destination for many tourists, it is important that the town have adequate emergency vehicles and equipment available to assist those in need. The new ambulance will make the department more efficient which could be the difference between life and death. Included with the purchase will be two Power Stretchers which will provide for the easy loading/unloading of patients. The Power Stretchers will be installed on the new ambulance and on another emergency vehicle. The Power Stretchers will not only provide for a smooth transition in and out of the ambulance but will reduce the possibility of injuries to the emergency personnel.

Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide a wide range of technical assistance to towns and/or groups of towns operating together in Androscoggin, Franklin, and Oxford counties, with the goal of reducing the amount of toxicity of disposed waste, improving the resiliency of the local and regional waste systems. This project will enhance efficiencies and reduce costs; increase institutional capacity, compliance, and resiliency; protect the environment and public health; and improve waste reduction, recycling, and reuse. With 17 years of help from Rural Developments the Solid Waste Management Grant program, tax dollars have been saved, local capacity and resiliency have improved, safety and environmental protection has increased, and the amount and toxicity of wastes disposed has been decreased. The recent priorities are handling organics, demolition debris, and conversion to single stream recycling. Municipal officers and site operators also change over time requiring re-education relative to solid waste and recycling processing and procedures.

naics_industry_sector: Health Care and Social Assistance (62)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will purchase the building/land that houses its Main Office at 248-260 Main Street, Presque Isle, Maine. Aroostook Agency on Aging will also improve the property through upgrades to Suites Al and B to improve usability of the space, HVAC modernization, roof repairs, and parking lot upgrades. The Agency was incorporated in 1973 with the mission of improving the quality of life, maximizing the independence, and promoting the well-being of elderly people in Northern Maine. In Aroostook in the last fiscal year (2020-2021), the Agency provided over 237,994 units of direct service to 7,045 residents of Aroostook County. These services included: 123,008 home delivered meals; monthly Commodity Food distribution to 1,585 residents; 66,703 hours of Eldercare service; and 16,282 responses to request for information and assistance. In addition, the Agency provided comprehensive case management, counseling, education and support services to many older adults and caregivers who are facing challenging life situations. The Agency current leases Suite B (7,800 sq ft) at 260 Main Street in Presque Isle where its main office is located.

funding_code: CF ARP EMERGENCY RURAL HEALTH CARE GRANTS - TRACK 1 & 2
naics_industry_sector: Health Care and Social Assistance (62)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to further support the immediate health care needs of the community related to the COVID-19 pandemic. The project goals are to increase their utilization of disease management tools from diagnosis through quarantine and isolation, including thermometers, pulse oximeters,food boxes, and to address patient and employee COVID-19 testing in an effort to minimize further infectious spread throughout the community. Cary Medical Center is a municipally-owned acute care hospital and will be partnering with Pines Health Services (a federally- qualified health center).

funding_code: CF ARP EMERGENCY RURAL HEALTH CARE GRANTS - TRACK 1 & 2
naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to obtain funding for Fish River Rural Health, a non-profit, federally qualified community health center, successfully operating for over 30 years. They provide primary care, dental, optometry, chiropractic care, telehealth medicine and food distribution services. They serve the northern most towns in Aroostook County in the St. John Valley area. The COVID-19 pandemic exacerbated the inequity for rural residents and was compounded by the Canadian border closure. Most border community residents have historically crossed the U.S. and Canadian border for dental and optometry services. Since March of 2020, they have seen an increase of 100 rural residents being seen, per month, at this facility. The primary purpose of the grant is to support Fish River Rural Health in their continued efforts to diagnose and manage COVID-19 and other future pandemics throughout the Northern Aroostook County communities.This will be achieved by purchasing the necessary equipment for family medicine, dental, optometry services, along with technology and food distribution services as they relate to COVID-19.

Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to upgrade and improve the Eagle Lake Water and Sewer Districts waste water treatment facility and pump stations. The system is nearing 40 years in service and many components are reaching the end of their useful life. This project will focus on renewing the aged components, modernizing system controls, making safety driven improvements, and correcting defective components. Improvements and replacement will include constructing a new influent, headworks, septage, and treatment pond flow control facility, renew the treatment and storage ponds by removing sludge, relining the ponds and installing a new aeration system.

naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to upgrade and improve the Eagle Lake Water and Sewer Districts waste water treatment facility and pump stations. The system is nearing 40 years in service and many components are reaching the end of their useful life. This project will focus on renewing the aged components, modernizing system controls, making safety driven improvements, and correcting defective components. Improvements and replacement will include constructing a new influent, headworks, septage, and treatment pond flow control facility, renew the treatment and storage ponds by removing sludge, relining the ponds and installing a new aeration system.

project_name: FY22 - Foxcroft Road and Clover Circle Lift Stations Upgrade (Add'l funds)
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to replace the Foxcroft Road and Clover Circle lift stations which serve the Houlton Band of Maliseet Indians. These two lift stations are 30 years old and were originally designed to handle 38 housing units. The lift stations serve the Riverside Village development of over 285 tribal citizens, which now includes 56 single family homes, seven duplex units, one six-unit and one eight-unit apartment complexes, and the tribal health clinic and tribal preschool complexes. The pump stations have experienced frequent backups creating a serious public health concern. The Houlton Band of Maliseet Indian tribal leadership worked diligently with the Maine Department of Environmental Protection, Indian Health Service, and the Houlton Water Company to secure this Rural Development investment as well as a $1,000,000 investment by the Maine Department of Environmental Protection. The new lift stations will have the increased capacity to handle all existing tribal users plus the expansion of an additional 25 households. Continuity of service will be enhanced with the addition of a generator at both lift stations. New technology upgrades will mitigate the threat of overflow events, and the cost of operation and maintenance will be greatly reduced.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: REAP-MAND RENEW ENERGY SYSTEMS LOANS GUAR
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide permanent financing to Gorham ME 1 LLC to build a 6.9 megawatt (MW), direct current (DC), ground-mounted solar project located in rural Gorham, Maine. The project has interconnection and net energy billing agreements in place with Central Maine Power Company. It is expected to produce 9,140,000 kilowatt hours (kWh) of electricity in the first full year of operation, and create three jobs at an average of $30/hour.

naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to finish the construction of a new educational/training facility (The Smith Center for Education and Research), which will provide the space, efficiencies, and logistics necessary to meet the organizations and clients needs. Wolfes Neck Farm Foundation was established in 1997 as a small non-profit organization for the purpose of engaging in charitable, educational, and scientific activities related to Alternative Farming Techniques, Conservation Management, Research, Education, and Public Stewardship. Wolfes Neck Farm is a one-of-a-kind place on the coast of Maine that connects farmers, eaters, and learners to the land and animals at the core of our food systems, while being stewards of the land. The Smith Center will enable the organization to expand upon a crucial need for education and research initiatives/development, as well as further assume the role of convener around topics related to their growing body of work. The new facility will enable Wolfes Neck Farm to increase their indoor workshops/seminars/camp meetings from a maximum of 18 participants to upwards of 150. Additional needs that will be met by the new facility include: a heated indoor growing space, a teaching kitchen, classroom space, dining area, and a small year-round retail space.

naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to reimburse for equipmentPine Tree State 4-H Club Foundaiton purchased for their Maine Innovation Lab & Learning Center (Magic Lantern) in Bridgton, Maine. The applicant will be receiving $450,000 in grant funding under the Congressionally Directed Spending Program, which is being administered through the Rural Development Community Facility Loan and Grant Program. The Organization reaches more than 30,000 Maine youth each year via their Camps and Learning Centers throughout the State.

project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide additional funding for the completion of a water main replacement project. The old water mains, which are comprised of unlined cast iron, have been susceptible to breaks, which is having an adverse impact upon the districts operating budget. The Bridgton Water District provides safe & reliable water services for the community. The rehabilitation improvements address the aging infrastructure and capacity issues in the project area, as well as restore the design capacity of the system at a reasonable cost. The proposed upgrades will help the distribution system operate more effectively and efficiently. The upgrades included in this project represent the highest priorities identified in the Districts Capital Efficiency Plan, which serves 730 rural residents, 134 commercial entities, and 2 industrial companies. The proposed project is in an Agency identified target area. Rural Development staff have been working within the Town over the past few years to extend our services and programs to help the communities enhance their mission. The proposed project will not only correct the systems current operating deficiencies, but will also help the Town improve their economic development opportunities

naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to construct a new waste water treatment facility, upgrade some aging sewer collection infrastructure, and to expand the system which will enable additional users in the greater downtown area to have access to public waste water services. The expansion portion of the project is expected to add 448 new customers, increasing the total number of customers on the system from 207 to 655. The proposed upgrades, which are long overdue, will help the system operate more effectively and efficiently, as well as address the Maine Department of Environmental Protection health and sanitary concerns. The project will not only correct the systems current operating deficiencies, but also help the Town improve their economic development opportunities.

Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to replace the Town of Wiltons aging water transmission main from the surface water source to the distribution system. The raw water intake is a 100-year-old cast iron pipe with a cribwork stabilizer at the inlet, the raw water pipeline is 5,700 feet of 100-year-old 12 inch unlined cast iron pipe and 2.500 feet of 75 year old 10 inch asbestos cement pipe. The finish water main is approximately 10,000 feet of 75-year-old asbestos cement pipe that is a mix of 10 inch and 8 inch. Also included is replacing the intake and raw water screen chamber, demolishing an unused booster pump station, and construction a flow control building in the same location, adding a booster pump system to the water treatment plant, improving telemetry, and replacing undersized water main on Main Street. The primary purpose of this project is to alleviate the health and sanitary problem and ensure that the water supplied to the customers meets all standards.

Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to upgrade the waste water treatment facility in the Town of Blue Hill to address immediate needs primarily consisting of replacement of failing equipment, which has reached the end of its useful life. Generators will be added and equipment replaced at the towns two pump stations. The facility was first constructed in 1975 and underwent a major upgrade in 2000. While the plant is currently working well and routinely meeting its effluent discharge license requirements, the equipment at the facility is either 46 years old if original, or 21 years old if part of the upgrade. This raises a concern given that the expected useful life of wastewater treatment process equipment is typically considered to be twenty-years. While the towns waste water treatment plant continues to serve the community well, its age and its location along the shore are valid concerns that should be considered as a high priority.

Camp Winnebago Inc. is a youth boys camp located in Fayette, Kennebec County, Maine. This project is expected to save $4,381 per year. It will replace 43,240 kilowatt hours (93 percent of the camps energy use) per year, which is enough energy to power 6 homes.

funding_code: RCDI RURAL COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT INITIATIVE GRANT
naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Island Institute continue its fellowship program in two low-income communities and build capacity to perform economic and community development activities. In the town of Columbia Falls, the fellowship program will provide technical assistance and build capacity to promote understanding and help preserve cultural, economic, and historical heritage for small farms and the sustainable growth of wild blueberries within a rare and iconic ecosystem. In the town of Vinalhaven, the fellowship program will provide technical assistance and build capacity to support a school-wide initiative to integrate technology in classroom learning from pre-K to 12th grade and co-leads the schools growing Lego robotics after-school program.

Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to improve the facilities that serve the high-pressure zone along the Harlow Hill Road and Backkingdom Road, as well as several other streets in Mexico, Maine. The facilities that serve this area include the Backkingdom standpipe, the Harlow Hill booster pump station, two pressure reducing valves, and distribution piping. The Mexico Water District will be replacing an existing welded steel water storage tank with a cast in place concrete reservoir, completing improvements to the Harlow Hill booster pump station, upgrading the two pressure reducing valves, and replacing the water main that is a 100-year-old unlined cast iron pipe that has outlived its useful life. These upgrades will maintain and improve the level of service provided to this area and will also increase the dependability of the system.

naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to reconstruct a portion of the Town of Norways sanitary sewer system. The current system is approaching 110 years of service and is nearing the end of its useful life. The Town of Norway is proposing to replace or reline sewers on several streets in the collection system, upgrade the Huntington Avenue Pump Station, and make several upgrades at the waste water treatment facility.

naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to reconstruct a portion of the Town of Norways sanitary sewer system. The current system is approaching 110 years of service and is nearing the end of its useful life. The Town of Norway is proposing to replace or reline sewers on several streets in the collection system, upgrade the Huntington Avenue Pump Station, and make several upgrades at the waste water treatment facility.

naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to replace the Hooper Ledge storage tank that is 100 years old, and has exceeded its expected service life, with a new prestressed concrete tank. The storage tank is anticipated to have a storage capacity of 500,000 gallons. Site improvements will include an upgraded access road. This replacement is in the Master Plan of June 2019 for the District and will benefit the Paris Utility District and the customers it serves, while improving the water quality in the Paris Utility District water system.

This loan will capitalize a revolving loan fund that will allow Eastern Maine Development Corporation to provide microloans to rural businesses. This project will help create 28 jobs and save 60 jobs, and support at least 15 area businesses.

funding_code: CF ARP EMERGENCY RURAL HEALTH CARE GRANTS - TRACK 1 & 2
naics_industry_sector: Health Care and Social Assistance (62)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase medical equipment, including one ventilator, patient monitoring system, 12 workstations on wheels, and 15 laptops. The proposed project focuses on equipment investment to address needs for access to health care services that have been intensified by the COVID-19 pandemic. Penobscot Valley Hospital does not have the volume to require an intensive care unit. It is critical patients are stabilized and then transferred to a facility as soon as possible. The pandemic has made it more challenging to transfer critical care patients to other facilities in a timely manner. An additional ventilator will provide advanced ventilation management for patients who may be held for longer period of times. The patient monitoring system is needed to adapt to surge capacity. It will cover the entire facility and allow hospital staff to monitor patients, providing constant and reliable data. The upgraded workstations will allow medical staff to care for more patients. The new laptops will assist the hospital with increasing its telehealth capabilities.

funding_code: CF ARP EMERGENCY RURAL HEALTH CARE GRANTS - TRACK 1 & 2
naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist the Center for Wabanaki Healing and Recovery solving regional health care issues, particularly those exacerbated by the COVID-19 pandemic. The Center for Wabanaki Healing and Recovery based on indigenous methods of healing focused on the whole health and wellbeing of individuals and the five Wabanaki communities of Maine. Comprised of multiple buildings that incorporate a cyclical structure of supports to encompass the whole being, the center will offer everything from Medication-Assisted Treatment to transitional housing, medicine walks cultivating traditional foods, childcare, telemedicine, and connecting with employers.

funding_code: CF ARP EMERGENCY RURAL HEALTH CARE GRANTS - TRACK 1 & 2
naics_industry_sector: Health Care and Social Assistance (62)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase medical equipment for the service site located in Dover-Foxcroft. Equipment to be purchased includes: pharmacy refrigeration and freezers for vaccine storage and administration; vehicle to transport vaccines and staff to COVID-19 vaccine clinics and to provide home delivery of pharmaceutical medications; medical exam room equipment and supplies for primary care, pediatrics, dental, walk-in care, laboratory, and testing services; equipment for sterilization and infection control; a generator; server and technology equipment to support and increase telehealth services and to support the electronic security system and other health care information technology systems; support equipment to support the Patient Assistance Department, which aid patients with barriers. Katahdin Valley Health Care is a network on nine clinics (Ashland, Brownville, Dover-Foxcroft, Houlton, Island Falls, Millinocket, Lincoln, and Patten) serving a population sparsely settled in a region with few resources. The communities served are very small and far apart. The area is poor, has high rates of chronic diseases, and suffers from numerous health disparities. It offers primary care, optometry, dental, podiatry, chiropractic, physical therapy and speech therapy, pharmacy, and behavioral health care to people of all ages regardless of ability to pay.

funding_code: CF ARP EMERGENCY RURAL HEALTH CARE GRANTS - TRACK 1 & 2
naics_industry_sector: Health Care and Social Assistance (62)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to expand the Katahdin Valley Health Center located in Brownville by adding 7,560 square feet to the existing 5,524 square foot building. The site will directly increase capacity for vaccine distribution, medical surge capacity, telehealth capabilities, and to support programs associated with food banks and food distribution. The project will include a designated infection control entrance and control area to be utilized for COVID-19 vaccination, testing, treating, and infection control purposes. Katahdin Valley Health Center is a network of nine clinics serving a poor, dispersed population that suffers from numerous health disparities. They are the communitys only option for primary care, dental, and behavioral health services; the current influx in new patients dictates a significant need to expand Katahdin Valley Health Centers infrastructure. The Brownville location alone experiences nearly a 30 percent increase in the number of patients served from 2020 to 2021. This renovation will give Katahdin Valley Health Center the ability to add additional primary care, expanded podiatry, optometry, chiropractic care, physical therapy, behavioral and mental health, and pharmacy services under one roof. These services will be available to people regardless of ability to pay.

naics_industry_sector: Professional, Scientific, and Technical Services (54)
naics_description: RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT IN THE PHYSICAL, ENGINEERING, AND LIFE SCIENCES
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase education technology equipment for the Green House Village Preschool located in Milford, Maine. The Courageous Steps Project Inc. was founded in 2016 with the purpose of supporting children and young adults with various disabilities and challenges to enhance their success in school and in life. The organization has supported more than 35 programs in eastern Maine. The Green House Village Preschool provides early childhood education and intervention services for children ages 3-6. The preschool is owned and operated by applicant and currently serves the town of Milford and the surrounding communities. Grant funds will be used for purchase educational technology equipment to upgrade current infrastructure, upgrade physical education equipment for students within the facility and in the outdoor learning spaces, and upgrade the classroom with newer equipment to better support the Preschool program. This equipment is needed for the ongoing development of programming for those children and families served under The Courageous Steps Project and its community programs.
