funding_code: CF ARP EMERGENCY RURAL HEALTH CARE GRANTS - TRACK 1 & 2
naics_industry_sector: Health Care and Social Assistance (62)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase an ambulance. The project focuses on an important equipment investment to address needs for access to health care services that have been intensified by the COVID-19 pandemic and future pandemics. More patients are needing medical transport to facilities that have the capacity to care for them. Ambulances also have more out-of-service time as they are thoroughly cleaned between runs. An additional ambulance will expand transport capacity for Piscataquis County. MRH Corp. currently performs 3,500-4,000 transports per year out of its three bases. The main base in Dover-Foxcroft is the largest. The pandemic and the high positivity rate in Piscataquis County have increased the transport volume of U-121 patients (those exhibiting COVID-19 symptoms). COVID-19 has also increased out-of-service time for ambulances as they are rigorously cleaned between runs. Transport of U-121 patients is markedly more complex than usual, requiring full personal protective equipment of the staff as well as respirators and face shields. State of the art, well-functioning equipment is necessary for the support of the staff and comfort of the patient.

funding_code: CF ARP EMERGENCY RURAL HEALTH CARE GRANTS - TRACK 1 & 2
naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
naics_description: OTHER PUBLIC BUILDING & IMPROVEMENT RELATED SERVICES
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to install a 600 cubic-foot freezer and a 48-kilowatt propane powered backup generator. Piscataquis Regional Food Center receives and redistributes 650,000 - 800,000 pounds of food per year from Good Shepherd Food Bank to 14 local food pantries. They also make deliveries to eligible house-bound seniors in the region. A critical component of Piscataquis Regional Food Centers ability to meet the communitys needs is the capacity to safely store food products in frozen, refrigerated, and shelf-stable forms until they can be delivered to rural distribution partners or direct to those in need. This requires a reliable and uninterrupted year-round source of electricity. Without backup power, their ability to support their community is at risk if there is any significant grid power disruption. The COVID-19 emergency demonstrated the rural regions need for food assistance can dramatically increase in scope with almost no warning. Current capacity was put under great stress for a prolonged period as the volume of frozen foods increased significantly for several months, disproportionate to refrigerated and shelf-stable products. More than a year later, they are still seeing unusually high frozen food storage needs relative to pre-COVID-19 conditions.

funding_code: CF ARP EMERGENCY RURAL HEALTH CARE GRANTS - TRACK 1 & 2
naics_industry_sector: Health Care and Social Assistance (62)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to fund critical equipment that has become essential during the COVID-19 pandemic. COVID-19 has had a significant impact on the community and has shown Charles A Dean the importance of one-stop shops for accessible and quality healthcare. This will fund three important equipment investments (digital imaging equipment, acute care beds and snowplowing equipment) to address specific patient care needs that have been intensified by the COVID-19 pandemic, as well as access to care in this rural setting. The proposed equipment will fill gaps within Charles A Deans larger effort to remake its century-old campus with smaller, modern, and adaptable facilities that embody a new and sustainable approach to rural health care.

naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase two law enforcement vehicles, particularly large Sport Utility Vehicles because they have room for the officers gear, they are off-road capable, plus have four-wheel drive. The deputies often travel two hours to reach a remote area, including remote campgrounds, and it is necessary they bring sufficient gear and equipment with them. Plus, this region of Maine experiences severe winter weather. Two cruisers are necessary to replace the high mileage vehicles.

naics_industry_sector: Health Care and Social Assistance (62)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase an ambulance to replace an existing vehicle that has reached the end of its expected useful life. This new, fully equipped ambulance will provide essential transportation to transport first responders and all of the necessary equipment to provide advanced emergency services, especially with the current COVID pandemic and opioid crisis.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: MAND. RENEW ENERFY SYSTEMS GRANTS UNDER $20,000
naics_industry_sector: Professional, Scientific, and Technical Services (54)
naics_description: ALL OTHER PROFESSIONAL, SCIENTIFIC, AND TECHNICAL SERVICES
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help TMDE Calibration Labs Inc. install a new 20.16-kilowatt, roof mount solar photovoltaic system. TMDE Calibration Labs Inc. is located in Richmond, Sagadahoc County, Maine. The system will generate 44,810 kilowatt hours (100+ percent of the business energy use) per year, which is enough energy to power 3.8 homes. The array will provide an uninterrupted power supply for the business and offer true measurement of power for sensitive uses of equipment. The project meets the criteria listed in the Maine REAP FY22 State Director Points memo by helping achieve geographic diversity for renewable energy systems projects located along Maines Coastline.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
naics_industry_sector: Management of Companies and Enterprises (55)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Grant-Tates Building, LLC., a small scale redevelopment company in Bath, Maine, install a new solar photovoltaic system. This project is expected to generate 41,500 kilowatt hours (30 percent of the estimated business energy use when fully operational) per year.According to the EPA, this is the equivalent to powering 5.7 homes for one year and greenhouse gas emissions being avoided by 10.2 tons of waste recycled instead of landfilled.

funding_code: DISC VAL ADD AG PRD MKT DV GT-BDG/SOC DISADV
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist agricultural producers seeking to establish or expand markets for their value-added agricultural products. Apple Creek Farm LLC will use the working capital grant funds to expand processing, marketing, and sales of their certified organic eggs, beef, chicken, sheep, goats, and sheepskins. This project will allow for an increase in customer base and revenue and will add two employees.

naics_industry_sector: Manufacturing (31-33)
naics_description: SAWMILL, WOODWORKING, AND PAPER MACHINERY MANUFACTURING
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide financing to Maine Timber Mats LLC to purchase a new 1.5 MBTU biomass boiler system to provide heat for the entire multi-building sawmill in New Portland, Maine. The new system will provide an estimated energy replacement amount of 2,500 MMBTU, replacing existing low-efficiency solid fuel and fossil fuel heating boilers.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: MAND. RENEW ENERFY SYSTEMS GRANTS UNDER $20,000
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Balfour Farm LLC, an off-grid organic dairy farm and cheese maker located in Pittsfield, in Somerset County, Maine, install a new 16.06- kilowatt solar photovoltaic system. This project is expected to save $7,950 per year. It will replace 19,008 kilowatt hours (62 percent of the farm energy use) per year, which is enough energy to power 2.6 homes.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: MAND. RENEW ENERFY SYSTEMS GRANTS UNDER $20,000
naics_industry_sector: Transportation and Warehousing (48-49)
naics_description: OTHER SUPPORT ACTIVITIES FOR AIR TRANSPORTATION
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Curtis Air, a family run aircraft repair facility, located in Pittsfield, Somerset County, Maine, install a new 36- kilowatt (kW), roof mount solar photovoltaic system. This project is expected to save $4,538 per year. It will generate 44,810 kilowatt hours (kWh) (100+ percent of the business energy use) per year, which is enough energy to power 6.2 homes.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: REAP-MAND RENEW ENERGY SYSTEMS LOANS GUAR
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide permanent financing to Somerset Solar LLC to build a 6.8-megawatt, ground-mounted solar facility located in Pittsfield, Maine. The project has interconnection and net energy billing agreements in place with Central Maine Power Company and is expected to produce 8,856,000 kilowatt-hours (kWh) of electricity in the first full year of operation. It will create three jobs at an average of $30/hour. This project is in a mapped equity area.

funding_code: CF ARP EMERGENCY RURAL HEALTH CARE GRANTS - TRACK 1 & 2
naics_industry_sector: Real Estate and Rental and Leasing (53)
naics_description: LESSORS OF OTHER REAL ESTATE PROPERTY
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to construct a 49,700- square-foot health care and wellness facility in Palmyra, Maine to help meet the needs of the community in light of the COVID-19 pandemic. The project is necessary to bring a safe place for testing, especially during a pandemic, air quality, access to high quality care, Medication Assisted Therapy, food cupboard, teaching kitchen, dental addition, and jobs to the rural communities in the service area. The existing, leased facility no longer meets the applicants needs as their business operations have outgrown the small facility size and pandemic restrictions have hampered its ability to provide adequate services to the service area. The pandemic has brought anxiety, depression, and loneliness to many. Currently, Sebasticook Family Doctors does not have the capacity to provide these services safely. The new innovative design of the facility will allow socially distant patient flow, isolated medical pods, and isolated indoor testing.

naics_industry_sector: Wholesale Trade (42)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase various equipment and gear necessary to operate the Hartland Volunteer Fire Department, which is comprised of 26 volunteer firefighters. The equipment to be purchased is used in daily firefighting and is needed to upgrade and replace worn and dilapidated equipment.The facility serves a rural community and distressed community in Somerset County. The county is very limited regarding economic opportunities and has the highest unemployment rates in the state. The new equipment is essential to protecting the citizens of Hartland.

Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to develop an additional 5.3 acres at the Hartland Landfill, based on waste acceptance projections, to accommodate the Towns needs for approximately 13 years. Without this development, the Town would have to cease waste acceptance within the next 8 to 12 months. The Town of Hartland is operating a 3.5-acre Special Waste landfill that is state-of-the-art with leak detection and liner systems in place. The operation sends the leachate all the way to the waste water treatment plant where any solids get pulled out and returned to the landfill, and the water is returned to the environment. The development of the remaining licensed 5.3 acres will have the same leak detection capabilities and liners that the existing area has. The development of this area will provide a service to neighboring towns, businesses, as well as continuing to service our own town. We estimate that, at current waste placement levels, we will add approximately 12 to 15 years of life to the landfill operation. In addition, a fence for privacy will be added and a set of scales for better on-site control and measurement of incoming waste streams.

naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used replace approximately 26,800 linear feet of transmission main. The mains are old, unlined cast iron pipe with leaded joints and a significant vulnerability to the district. The replacement of the leaded joints will resolve a health and sanitary issue for the district and is within the scope of the Administrations Justice40 Initiative. The water system consists of a surface water source (Hancock Pond), slow sand filtration, treatment plant, clear well, transmission mains, 3 storage facilities and the distribution system. The distribution system consists of a mixture of recently upgraded lines and old cast iron piping. The transmission main (raw and treated) is a significant piece of the system at approximately 12 miles long. The pipeline is comprised of 26,800 linear feet of unlined 16-inch cast iron pipe with leaded joints that is over 100 years old and 7,000 feet of unlined 14-inch cast iron pipe with leaded joints that is over 100 years old. This project will significantly improve the reliability of the system that provides domestic water and fire protection for the community.

naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to propose a two-pronged solid waste management project which addresses low recycling rates and an urgent per-and polyfluoroalkyl substances (PFAS)contamination challenge. The project seeks to increase recycling rates to 50% for eight targeted municipalities, and plans to do so by expanding conventional recycling, food, textile, and household hazardous waste diversion. Since their service region is one of the nations PFAS contamination hot spots, they propose to provide technical assistance to municipalities for the assessment of PFAS in the waste stream and regional coordination of treatment options. Through their participation in technical assistance and recycling programs, these eight municipalities will derive measurable financial benefit and improved environmental quality and public health outcomes. Domestic infrastructure for recycled materials is lucrative and premium recycled materials are in high-demand; yet, small rural municipalities have not benefited from this growing market because they have no recycling centers or no process for separating recyclables.

project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Catherine Durkin, owner of Calyx Farm an organic vegetable farm located in Morrill, Waldo County, Maine, install a new 10.56-kilowatt (kW), roof mount solar photovoltaic system. This project is expected to save $2,119 per year. It will generate 16,820 kilowatt hours (kWh) (76 percent of the farm energy use) per year, which is enough energy to power 1.8 homes.

Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to upgrade the waste water treatment facility from a primary treatment facility to a secondary treatment facility with tertiary treatment for disinfection. The investment will also be used for upgrades to all eight of the Towns pump stations. New conventional activated sludge aeration tanks will be constructed to provide secondary treatment. Disinfection prior to effluent discharge into Searsport Harbor will be accomplished through tertiary treatment via disc filters. The waste water treatment facility upgrades are required to meet the conditions of the Maine Department of Environmental Protection draft discharge permit.

naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide business-based training and technical assistance to rural microborrowers and potential microborrowers throughout Washington County.

funding_code: CF ARP EMERGENCY RURAL HEALTH CARE GRANTS - TRACK 1 & 2
naics_industry_sector: Health Care and Social Assistance (62)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to obtain funding for Eastport Health Care Inc., a non-profit, federally-qualified community health center providing primary care, dental, and mental health services throughout Washington County, located along Maines Central Eastern Coast. They also offer comprehensive health care services including adult and pediatric primary health care, womens health, podiatry, prescription assistance, benefits counseling, case management, diabetes support, and nutrition and health education. Eastport has successfully operated for more than 40 years and serves more than 3,800 patients each year. Its geographic territory stretches from Machias to Calais, and to Lubec. The proposed project consists of personnel for the successful management of COVID patients, food distribution, equipment and supplies to accommodate the increase in testing for diagnosis and mitigation measures.

naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to construct a 24 X 30 addition to the food pantry that will effectively double their food storage capacity. The plans include a loading dock extension to a roll-up loading door located at the north side of the facility and improvements to the driveway to facilitate large truck deliveries directly into the pantry. Equipment needed for the facility include rolling shelves, reach-in coolers for self-service, flat-topped rolling handcarts and a short-turn radius pallet jack. Greater Eastport Ecumenical Center Association is a food pantry operating as Labor of Love Food Pantry and Nutrition Center. It houses the food pantry and teaching kitchen for the greater Eastport area. One half of the facility is a public area used strictly for food distribution, a demonstration kitchen, administration, and reception area. The other half is a food storage area with a walk-in cooler, small utility room and shelving. The Labor of Love Food Pantry serves up to 200 households monthly.

funding_code: REAP-MAND RENEW ENERGY SYSTEMS LOANS GUAR
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide permanent financing to Knights Pond Solar LLC to build a 4.98 megawatt (MW), direct current (DC), ground-mounted solar project in rural South Berwick, Maine. The project has interconnection and net energy billing agreements in place with Central Maine Power Company and is expected to produce 7,053,032 kilowatt hours (kWh) of electricity in the first full year of operation while also creating three jobs at an average of $30/hour.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: MAND. RENEW ENERFY SYSTEMS GRANTS UNDER $20,000
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Timber Ridge Farm install a new 25.92-kilowattm, roof-mount solar photovoltaic system. Timber Ridge Farm is a horse and dog training and boarding facility located in Saco, York County, Maine, This project is expected to save $2,211 per year. It will generate 31,665 kilowatt hours (100+ percent of the business energy use) per year, which is enough energy to power 4.4 homes. The project meets the criteria listed in the Maine REAP FY22 State Director Points memo by helping achieve geographic diversity for renewable energy systems projects located along Maines Coastline.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
naics_industry_sector: Manufacturing (31-33)
naics_description: ALL OTHER MISCELLANEOUS WOOD PRODUCT MANUFACTURING
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide financing to T&D Wood Energy LLC to purchase a diesel-powered horizontal grinder and an existing green hammermill with a turnkey green grinding system in Sanford, Maine. The new system will eliminate the bottleneck and replace the mechanical defects in the system, while providing a more robust, safe and energy efficient green grinding system.The project will eliminate the current process that uses more than 24,000 gallons of diesel fuel per year. It will also reduce combustion of diesel fuel and Nox and CO2 emissions from portable engines on-site that a currently required to prepare raw material for grinding.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: REAP-MAND RENEW ENERGY SYSTEMS LOANS GUAR
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide permanent financing to Crowley Solar, LLC to build a 3.0 mega-watt DC ground-mounted solar project located in rural Sabattus, Maine. The project has interconnection and net energy billing agreements in place with Central Maine Power Company and is expected to produce 4,377,828 kilowatt-hours of electricity in the first full year of operation. This will create three jobs at an average of $30 hour.

funding_code: REAP IRA RES GRANT $20K AND LESS (FY 23)
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Grand View Stables, a horse riding and boarding facility located in Sabattus, Androscoggin County, Maine, install a new 37.77 kilowatt (kW) roof mount solar photovoltaic system. This project is expected to save $4,831 per year. It will generate 49,025 kilowatt hours (25 plus percent of the business energy use) per year, which is enough energy to power 4.1 homes for one year.

naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide-business based training and technical assistance to rural microborrowers and potential microborrowers throughout Androscoggin, Franklin, and Oxford Counties. Technical assistance is an essential part of the microlending process. It often makes the difference between the success or failure of a new business, affecting the ability of the microborrower to repay its debt in a timely fashion.

naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase snowmobile trail-grooming equipment for the town of Easton, Maine. This equipment will replace an old, high-maintenance trail groomer. The project is vital to ensure continued access during the winter months to 11 local small and emerging businesses.

naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase snowmobile trail-grooming equipment. The equipment will replace an old, high- maintenance, heavy-duty, trail-groomer-drag. The project is vital to the winter economy, ensuring continued access to local businesses. It will benefit nine small and emerging businesses and save one job.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: REAP IRA EEI GRANT $20K AND LESS (FY 23)
naics_industry_sector: Retail Trade (44-45)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help The Old Horse Barn, LLC., DBA as Gateway Trading Post complete a three-phase energy efficiency improvement project. The project will consist of installing three highly efficient heat-pumps, lighting upgrades throughout the store, and replacing the main entrance door. The estimated energy savings is 171,736,280 BTUs and cost savings of $4,613.80 annually. This is the equivalent to powering 6.9 homes for one year.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: REAP IRA RES GRANT $20K AND LESS (FY 23)
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Whitney Brook LLC, DBA Wood Prairie Family Farm, located in Bridgewater, Aroostook County, Maine, install a new 29.44 kilowatt (kW) roof mount solar photovoltaic system. This project is expected to save $6,347 per year. It will generate 38,867 kilowatt hours (kWh) (100 plus percent of the business energy use) per year, which is enough energy to power 3.3 homes for one year.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: REAP IRA RES GRANT $20K AND LESS (FY 23)
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Pierre LaPlante, DBA LaPlante Farms, construct a geothermal heating system for a new machine building. LaPlante Farms has been producing commercial hay and straw since 2001. The system is anticipated to produce 11,229kWh to heat the building annually, equating to an annual savings of $4,978. The project will reduce the dependence on fossil fuels.

naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to support the development and ongoing success of microentrepreneurs and microenterprises in Aroostook County, Washington County, Piscataquis County and Northern Penobscot County, Maine. This loan will capitalize a revolving loan fund that will allow Northern Maine Development Commission to provide fixed-interest rate microloans to rural businesses.

naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide training and technical assistance to microloan borrowers and micro entrepreneurs. Technical assistance is an essential part of the microlending process. It often makes the difference between the success or failure of a new business, affecting the ability of the microborrower to repay its debt in a timely fashion.

funding_code: CF ARP EMERGENCY RURAL HEALTH CARE GRANTS - TRACK 1 & 2
naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to obtain funding for Fish River Rural Health (FRRH), a non-profit, federally qualified community health center (FQHC), successfully operating for over 30 years. FRRH provides primary care, dental, optometry, chiropractic care, telehealth medicine and food distribution services. They serve the northern most towns in Aroostook County in the St. John Valley area. The COVID-19 pandemic exacerbated the inequity for rural residents and was compounded by the Canadian border closure. Most border community residents have historically crossed the U.S. and Canadian border for dental and optometry services. Since March of 2020, they have seen an increase of 100 rural residents being seen, per month, at this facility. The primary purpose of the grant is to support FRRH in their continued efforts to diagnose and manage COVID-19 and other future pandemics throughout the Northern Aroostook County communities. This also assists in supporting the surge of new patients since the pandemic. This will be achieved by purchasing the necessary equipment for dental services, along with technology and food distribution services as they relate to COVID-19.

naics_industry_sector: Arts, Entertainment, and Recreation (71)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to construct a 24 foot by 100 foot addition that will be attached to the full length of the west side of the existing artifacts storage/display barn. The addition will consist of a 24 foot by 100 foot sixteen inch thick concrete slab that will be reinforced with four inches of six by six wire mesh and attached to existing barn foundation with one-half inch rebar at three foot intervals. The addition will provide the needed space to store and preserve the applicants artifacts.

program: SEARCH - Special Evaluation Assistance for Rural Communities and Households Grant (WEP)
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide upgrades to the wastewater treatment facility. This funding will be used to evaluate the remaining capacity of the Greater Limestone Regional Wastewater Treatment Facility and identify upgrades and the cost for upgrades needed to accept and treat over 2 million gallons of septage per year. From discussions with DEP, it is Wright-Pierces understanding that the study will not include evaluation of septage quantities, locations of where septage pumped, potential regional septage regional septage acceptance locations to minimize trucking distance or the cost effectiveness/feasibility of septage haulers trucking to Greater Limestone Regional Wastewater Treatment Facility.

program: Food Supply Chain Guaranteed Loan Program
naics_industry_sector: Accommodation and Food Services (72)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help offset the costs associated with purchasing and making improvements to the acquired facility, and purchasing equipment. Fork Food Hub, L3C is a mission driven limited liability company subsidiary of Fork Food Lab (FFL). FFL is a non-profit food business incubator that focuses on growing the local food economy by providing shared food manufacturing space to start-up food businesses. This facility will allow FFL to increase its member companies from 55 to 90. Member companies are provided workspace, equipment, resources, technical assistance, and access to locally sourced ingredients. FFL lowers the cost and risk of starting up a food enterprise and allows the companies to grow and sustainably enter the food marketplace. Sixty percent of FFL members are women owned businesses; 20% are black, indigenous, or people of color. There is a substantial increase in the number of members from the immigrant and New Mainer community. The new facility will make an additional 17,000 square feet of rentable space available to established and growing food businesses.

program: Meat and Poultry Intermediary Lending Program (MPILP)
naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help capitalize a revolving loan fund to be administered by Coastal Enterprises Inc. The new fund will help livestock and poultry processors in the New England states access capital to increase meat processing capacity. Coastal Enterprises will continue to work to increase access to processing for the many small livestock farmers in the region to provide both access to affordable capital and industry-specific technical expertise to support regional processing facilities start-up or expansion. Coastal Enterprises Inc. will continue to leverage its decades of food-focused lending to help build a vibrant and resilient future for meat and poultry processors in the New England states.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: REAP IRA RES GRANT $20K AND LESS (FY 23)
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Mere Point Company LLC, build a 14.4kW Roof-mount Solar PV Array in Brunswick, Maine. The system is expected to generate 19,530 kWh annually with an estimated annual cost savings of $3,596. According to the EPA this is the equivalent to powering 1.5 homes for one year and the equivalent to greenhouse gas emissions avoided by 2.9 tons of waste recycled instead of landfilled.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
naics_industry_sector: Retail Trade (44-45)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to install a 24.93 kilowatt (kW) roof-mounted solar photovoltaic system at MUA Lobster LLC in Brunswick, Cumberland County, Maine. The project annually is expected to save $6,475; generate 29,790 kilowatt hours (kWh) (33 percent), enough energy to power four homes; and recycle rather than landfill 7.3 tons of waste to reduce greenhouse gas emissions.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help install a 10.9 kilowatt (kW) roof-mounted solar photovoltaic system at Broadturn Farm, a small-scale flower and vegetable farm in Scarborough, Cumberland County, Maine. The system annually is expected to offset more than 14,085 pounds of carbon dioxide (CO2), 719 gallons of gasoline, or 14 barrels of oil. This project annually is expected to save $2,603 and generate 14,372 kilowatt hours (kWh) (more than 100 percent), enough energy to power approximately one home.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
naics_industry_sector: Construction (23)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help install a 25.5 kW roof-mounted solar photovoltaic (PV) system at Maine Post and Beam LLC in North Yarmouth, Cumberland County, Maine. The system annually is expected to save thousands of liters of water and 2,418 gallons of gasoline plus offset 23,775 pounds of coal. It annually will generate 30,322 kWh (more than 100 percent).

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help install a 27.135 kilowatt (kW) roof mounted solar photovoltaic system at Flying Goat Farm LLC, a goat milk and cheese farm in New Gloucester, Cumberland County, Maine. The system annually is expected to offset more than 14,085 pounds of carbon dioxide (CO2), 719 gallons of gasoline, or 14 barrels of oil. This project annually is expected to save $4,246, enough energy to power slightly more than one home.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to install a new 48 kilowatt (kW) roof mount solar photovoltaic system. Taildragger Stables LLC is a horse riding and boarding facility in New Gloucester, Cumberland County, Maine. This project is expected to save $7,440 per year. It will generate 56,411 kilowatt hours (kWh) (over 100 percent of the business energy use) per year. According to the Environmental Protection Agency, this is equivalent to powering 7.8 homes for one year and 13.8 tons of waste recycled instead of landfilled.

naics_description: OTHER VEGETABLE (EXCEPT POTATO) AND MELON FARMING
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help William H. Jordan Farm use the working capital grant funds to expand processing, marketing, and sales of its locally produced, frozen, and shelf-stable produce. This project will increase the number of customers shopping at the on-farm store and expand its line of frozen and shelf-stable products through retail and wholesale channels. This project will allow for an increase in customer base and revenue.

naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to reimburse the applicant for some facility upgrades at the food bank in Harrison, Cumberland County, Maine. The organization provides assistance to more than 500 families each week in multiple southwestern Maine Counties.

project_name: FY 23 WWTF and Pump Station Upgrades Project
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to rehabilitate the Freeport Sewer Districts wastewater treatment plant and collection system. The project will ease any health and sanitary concerns by allowing the plant and system to operate more effectively and efficiently. These upgrades represent the highest priorities in the districts master plan and will create the greatest benefit to the collection system. Some of the plants original equipment and processes are nearly fifty years old, and the facility is well past the twenty-year useful life of its original design.The project will also help the town improve overall economic development opportunities.

project_name: FY 23 WWTF and Pump Station Upgrades Project
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)

Some of the original equipment and processes are nearly 50 years old, well beyond their 20-year useful life. These long overdue upgrades will help the system operate more effectively and efficiently, and alleviate health and sanitary concerns. The upgrades are the highest priorities in the districts master plan and will make key improvements to the collection system. The project will also help the towns economic development opportunities.

borrower_name: Southwest Harbor Water and Sewer District
project_name: FY17 SEARCH FY18 WW Treatment Upgrades/FY23 Add'l Funding
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to fund additional costs necessary to upgrade the districts Wastewater Treatment Facility and pump stations. The project will remove processing equipment that has exceeded its useful life, replace and expand structures, and improve overall efficiencies of the treatment process. The improvements include building upgrades, three pump station upgrades, blowers, sludge pumps, dumping station, sludge dewatering, and clarifiers. Upon completion of the project the district will be in compliance with their Maine Department of Environmental Protection discharge permit. Modernization will minimize the potential for discharge of untreated sewage into the Atlantic Ocean.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: REAP-MAND RENEW ENERGY SYSTEMS LOANS GUAR
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide permanent financing to RE Gardiner Solar, LLC to build a 4.7 mega-watt DC ground-mounted solar project located in rural Gardiner, Maine. The project has interconnection and net energy billing agreements in place with Central Maine Power Company and is expected to produce 6,093,000 kilowatt-hours of electricity in the first full year of operation. This will create three jobs at an average of $30 hour.

funding_code: RCDI RURAL COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT INITIATIVE GRANT
naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment proposes "Building Community Strength: A Community Planning Capacity-Building Program" to help build and strengthen the capacity of low-income, socially vulnerable communities in rural Maine. This program will employ a train-the-trainer model, in which one or two trainees in each of the 10 recipient towns will receive training in land use planning processes that will address critical issues including farmland protection and farm viability, affordable housing, and climate change prevention and mitigation. Importantly, this training will emphasize the interconnections among these issues, to recognize that effective planning and strategies to address one issue can and should coordinate with and support others.

naics_industry_sector: Educational Services (61)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide funding for the purchase and upgrade of a facility. This Charter School serves grades 9-12. The schools enrollment has grown from 105 students in 2016 to 225 students in 2022. The new facility will provide the school and students with the space necessary for a conducive learning environment. RD staff have been working within the city over the past few years to extend our services and programs to help the community enhance their mission. The proposed project will not only correct the schools operating deficiencies, but also help them, and the city, improve their economic development opportunities.

funding_code: RCDI RURAL COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT INITIATIVE GRANT
naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to build capacity and technical expertise while helping to improve the quality of life in three low-income, rural Maine communities through the placement of Island Fellows. Sunrise Trails Coalition: the fellowship program will provide technical assistance and build capacity to improve the trail in this region so that all users can maximize the trails highest and best uses for health, wellness, alternative transportation, and as a social gathering place. Town of Brooklin: the fellowship program will provide technical assistance and build capacity for a town-wide initiative providing homeowners with information, resources, support to access alternative energy programs, and assist the town to increase the energy efficiency in public buildings. A Climate to Thrive: the fellowship programwill provide technical assistance and capacity to the Town of Tremont to create the Tremont Community Resilience Plan by hosting listening sessions, creating and disseminating a town-wide survey, building a virtual community bulletin board, and culminating the writing of the plant and completing a greenhouse gas inventory.

project_name: FY 23 WWTF Improvements Project (FY24 Add'l Funds)
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to make necessary improvements to the town of Bethel wastewater treatment facility which include replacement of the grit pump, grit classifier, blowers, programmable logic controllers, generator, replacing the drives and damaged internal equipment of the clarifier internals, headworks roof, and replacing the two single impeller aerators with two dual impeller aerators. This also includes completing necessary electrical repairs. The improvements recommended at the facility are intended to allow long-term reliability of the facility and its processes. The improvements will allow optimization of treatments systems, reduce the amount of energy and labor required for running the facility, and ensure the robustness of critical mechanical equipment. It is considered best to proactively replace or rehabilitate equipment that has reached the end of its useful life, to avoid costly and time-consuming measures in the future.

program: Rural Energy for America Technical Assistance Grant Program

naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide business-based training and technical assistance to rural microborrowers and potential microborrowers throughout Hancock, Knox, Penobscot, Piscataquis, Waldo, and Washington counties. Technical assistance is an essential part of the microlending process. It often makes the difference between the success or failure of a new business, affecting the ability of the microborrower to repay its debt in a timely fashion.

funding_code: CF ARP EMERGENCY RURAL HEALTH CARE GRANTS - TRACK 1 & 2
naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to renovate the first and second floor of a more than 35,000-square-foot recently acquired building in Belfast, Maine. The first floor will house integrated adult and pediatric primary care services (mental health, case management, and medical); walk-in care; and a recovery program for opioid-use disorder. The second floor will accommodate dental services, community rooms, and administrative offices. There are not enough primary and mental health-care providers in this region. The current leased space is quite small and severely limits medical services. During the COVID-19 pandemic, a camp trailer was purchased just to meet demand for tests and vaccinations. Belfasts Seaport Community Health Center opened nearly 40 years ago, becoming part of Penobscot Community Health Center in 2013. It currently has 60 employees who serve approximately 8,000 patients annually. In the heart of Waldo County, one of Maines poorer counties, the Belfast community suffers from increasing rates of mental illness and substance-use disorder along with poor rates of primary care use.

naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to construct a fire station in the town of Bradford, Maine. The current fire station occupies the very first schoolhouse built in Bradford and has been reconfigured many times in its history. This is a point of serious concern for both the town and volunteer fire department. The building is structurally unsound; too restricted for safe entry, parking, and exit of modern fire trucks; and without any handicap accessibility.

naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to construct a fire station in the Town of Newburgh, Maine to replace an existing fire station. The existing fire station is a deteriorated building that is over 50 years old, and is too cramped to provide safe access around the vehicles, does not offer accessibility, is structurally unsound, and the ceiling height is too low to safely park the fire trucks. The existing facility also has several structural hazards and has a black mold infestation that was not resolved with prior remediation efforts. The new facility will be safer and will readily accommodate larger, modern firefighting vehicles.

naics_industry_sector: Health Care and Social Assistance (62)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used purchase a security camera system for all five of Millinocket Regional Hospitals facilities. The current system provides limited coverage within the facility, but no outside coverage, and no ability to dispatch emergency assistance in the event of a threat or a disaster. Law enforcement coverage is limited in their rural area and response times vary considerably. They must be able to provide for staff safety and respond independently until help arrives. This project will provide for real-time dispatch of emergency service personnel, establish remote access for local law enforcement and fire and emergency service personnel, and establish a digital monitoring system that allows for recording, storage, and monitoring of all Millinocket Regional Hospital locations.

naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to build a facility to meet the safe, operational requirements of a fire station, comply with the National Fire Protection Association and meet the needs of the department. The station will have an apparatus bay to house existing apparatus at modern vehicle size standards including two pumpers, one tanker and one forestry truck. The apparatus bay will be sized for all-terrain vehicle, snowmobile, and rescue boat storage, which is currently needed by the department. Additional future space for one truck is required to meet the expected community growth over the life of the facility. In addition to the apparatus bay, significant support space is needed for safe and efficient operation. The current fire station was built in 1952 to meet the needs of the community for its projected life and provides space for three trucks, two small offices, a bathroom, storage closet and a hose tower. Water damage over the years has caused deterioration to the roof structure and a significant mold issue in the attic area and the chiefs office. Overall, the building is too small to accommodate modern fire trucks and all the equipment.

naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to construct a fire station in the Town of Plymouth, ME to replace an existing fire station. The old fire station was built in 1972, with subsequent additions. While maintained, water damage and movement of the building slab made the facility structurally unsafe. The overhead doors had to be removed to access the vehicles, causing a significant safety concern for fire personnel and the towns citizens. The new facility was built to modern building codes and accommodates larger modern equipment, including two pump trucks, one tanker, two forestry trucks, and an EMS vehicle. There is also room to accommodate an ATV, snowmobile, and rescue boat storage.

naics_description: OTHER FIRE/RESCUE & PUBLIC SAFETY RELATED SERVICES
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to construct a public safety facility to replace the old fire station in the Town of Greenville, Maine. Recent growth in the community and the surrounding region require a modern facility that will address Greenvilles needs today and for the future. The existing fire station was built in 1963 and was not meeting the needs of a modern fire department. The new facility will be approximately 19,000 square feet and will house the fire department, police department and a community room. The building will serve as a warming shelter during emergency situations.

project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to complete the FY 2017 Treatment Plant Upgrades Project. Due to construction delays and supply chain shortages (primarily due to the COVID-19 pandemic) additional funding is required to complete the project. The funding will enable the district to complete the rehabilitation of their wastewater treatment plant and to provide some upgrades to the administrative office. The improvements address the aging infrastructure and capacity issues at the wastewater treatment plant, and address the MDEPs health and sanitary concerns. The upgrades included in this project represent the highest priorities identified in the districts capital efficiency plan.

project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide technical assistance to connect small businesses with funding and learning opportunities in Washington County, Maine. The Small Business and Entrepreneurship team at Sunrise County Economic Council (SCEC) oversees the MaineStreet Business Building. The team will design and offer collaboration and relationship-building opportunities to connect entrepreneurs and business owners in industry clusters, such as art, graphic design, finance, agriculture, fisheries, and others. The project will benefit eight small and emerging businesses and create one job. The applicant is contributing $53,448 to the project.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: REAP-MAND RENEW ENERGY SYSTEMS LOANS GUAR
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide permanent financing to Marshfield Solar, LLC to build a 2.4 mega-watt DC ground-mounted solar project located in rural Marshfield, Maine. The project has interconnection and net energy billing agreements in place with Versant Power Company and is expected to produce 3,093,048 kilowatt-hours of electricity in the first full year of operation. This will create three jobs at an average of $30 hour.

program: Rural Energy for America Technical Assistance Grant Program
naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Sunrise County Economic Council, provide Technical Assistance to recruit, engage, and assist qualified rural small businesses and agricultural producers, focused in distressed or disadvantaged communities, in applying for REAP grants for energy efficiency improvement and renewable energy systems.

naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help the Sunrise County Economic Council provide training and technical assistance to microloan borrowers and micro entrepreneurs in Washington County.

naics_industry_sector: Health Care and Social Assistance (62)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase a 3D mammography machine to replace the old one. This is a very much needed piece of equipment for the Calais Community Hospital. The Calais Hospital was incorporated in 1917 and continues to expand their services. They reorganized in 2019 (after filing bankruptcy) when it was purchased by Downeast Community Hospital of Machias, Maine and transitioned into Calais Community Hospital (CCH). They are the largest employer in Calais and surrounding towns, employing over 200 people. CCH is a critical access hospital for acute care and swing bed patients with a 24-hour physician-staffed emergency department. It serves Northeastern Washington County with an approximate population of 14,000 from Topsfield, ME to the North, Wesley to the West and Eastport to the South. The needed new digital mammography equipment will have the latest technology, including the addition of 3D tomosynthesis diagnostic accuracy at the same low dose as the 2D view. The newer systems will have a more patient focused comfort design with a variety of paddles to accommodate all women. Enhanced ergonomics and workflows make the technologists jobs easier, enabling a faster and smoother experience for both patient and staff. This new equipment will be housed in the current mammography room as part of the Womens Health Suite in the radiology department.

naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to launch Downeast Restorative Harvest, by Healthy Acadia, a community garden program with the Washington County Jail. The garden will be located on a parcel of county-owned land in Machias, Maine. The project will engage jail residents, members of the recovery community, horticultural educators, and other community members in growing food for the jails kitchen as well as for donation to local hunger relief programs. The cultivation of vegetables, flowers, and fruit trees, combined with horticultural training led by University of Maine Cooperative Extension, will provide jail residents and other participants with valuable life and employment skills, as well as opportunities to support and improve physical and mental health.

program: SEARCH - Special Evaluation Assistance for Rural Communities and Households Grant (WEP)
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to analyze the water system lines of the Lubec Water District (LWD) in the very rural town of Lubec, Maine. The current 100-year-old system includes over 17 miles of water lines. The aging infrastructure impacts overall water quality and rural-area water pressure. Fire hydrants are at the end of useful life and need upgrade or replacement. The distribution center itself needs a new SCADA system.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help install a new 48kW roof-mounted solar photovoltaic (PV) system at Harris Dairy Farm in Dayton, York County, Maine. The system is expected to offset over 64,297 pounds of CO2 from the atmosphere.This project annually is expected to save $14,609 and generate 65,609 kWh (more than 100 percent), enough energy to power nearly six homes.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
naics_industry_sector: Construction (23)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help install a 37.9 kW roof-mounted solar photovoltaic (PV) system at Jim Godbout Plumbing and Heating Inc. in Biddeford, York County, Maine. The system annually is expected to offset more than 44,335 pounds of carbon dioxide (CO2). This project annually will generate 45,240 kWh (more than 97 percent), enough energy to power nearly four homes.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
naics_industry_sector: Retail Trade (44-45)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Weirs Motor Sales, a family own auto dealership located in Arundel, in York County, Maine, install a new 288 kilowatt (kW) turnkey carport roof mounted solar photovoltaic system. This project is expected to generate 292,800 kilowatt hours (kWh) (71 percent of the business energy use) per year and save $68,955. This will offset over 286,944 pounds of carbon dioxide from the atmosphere. According to the Environmental Protection Agency this amount of energy is equivalent to powering 16 homes per year, 14,945 gallons of gasoline, or 307 barrels of oil.

naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to capitalize a revolving loan fund. The fund will be used to provide loans to ultimate recipients to promote community development, establish new businesses, establish and support lending programs, and create or retain employment opportunities in Aroostook, Penobscot, Piscataquis, and Washington counties.

naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to support the development and ongoing success of microentrepreneurs and microenterprises in Aroostook County, Washington County, Piscataquis County and Northern Penobscot County, Maine. This loan will capitalize a revolving loan fund that will allow Northern Maine Development Commission to provide fixed-interest rate microloans to rural businesses.

naics_industry_sector: Other Services (except Public Administration) (81)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Brunswick ANP LLC, a small real estate business located in Brunswick (Cumberland County), Maine, install a new 11.7 kilowatt (kW) roof mount solar photovoltaic system. The system will generate 13,455 kilowatt hours (kWh)(80+ percent of the business energy use) per year. According to the Environmental Protection Agency, this is the equivalent to 6,520 pounds of coal burned or 572 gallons of diesel consumed.

naics_industry_sector: Health Care and Social Assistance (62)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Douglas H MacGilpin LLC, located in Brunswick, Maine, install a new 29.16 kilowatt (kW) ground mount solar photovoltaic system. It will generate 33,285 kilowatt hours (kWh) (100 percent of the business energy use) per year. This project is expected to save $8,390 per year.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: REAP IRA RES GRANT $20K AND LESS (FY 23)
naics_industry_sector: Construction (23)
naics_description: NEW SINGLE-FAMILY HOUSING CONSTRUCTION (EXCEPT FOR-SALE BUILDERS)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help McDonnell Brothers Custom Builders LLC, located in Windham, Maine, install a new 5.67 kilowatt (kW) roof mount solar photovoltaic (PV) system. This project is expected to save $1,674 per year. It will generate 7,325 kilowatt hours per year (kWh).

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
naics_description: OTHER FOOD CROPS GROWN UNDER COVER
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide long-term financing to Vertical Harvest Maine L3C, to develop and operate a 51,000 square foot Controlled Environmental Agriculture hydroponic farm in Westbrook, Maine. The facility is expected to produce 2.3 million pounds of leafy greens each year and utilize equipment that will increase energy efficiency by more than 55 percent when compared to typical greenhouse practices. This funding, which includes a $25,000,000 Business and Industry loan guarantee, a $23,795,000 Rural Energy for America Program Energy Efficient Equipment loan guarantee, will be supplemented with a Commercial Property Assessed Clean Energy loan of $7,825,000 and a borrower contribution of $19,189,210. This project is expected to create 37 new jobs paying an average wage of $20 per hour.

According to the Environmental Protection Agency this is the equivalent to 46,778 pounds of coal burned or 4,102 gallons of diesel consumed.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
naics_industry_sector: Wholesale Trade (42)
naics_description: FRESH FRUIT AND VEGETABLE MERCHANT WHOLESALERS
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Green Thumb, in Fryeburg, Oxford County, Maine. This is a third-generation farm growing potatoes, beans, and corn. The project will implement a highly energy efficiency grain dryer. The project will save the organization 1,338,699,637 BTUs in energy usage and save $28,115 annually. According to the Environmental Protection Agency, this is the equivalent of powering 35 homes for one year, or 311,448 pounds of coal burned.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
naics_industry_sector: Accommodation and Food Services (72)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Fernwood Cove Inc., a summer camp for girls located in Harrison (Cumberland County), Maine, install a 83.64 kilowatt (kW) DC solar system consisting of three separate systems; 37.24 kW ground-mounted system, 36.8 kW roof-mounted system, and 9.6 kW roof-mounted system. The system will generate 107,000 kilowatt hours (kWh) (100+ percent of the business energy use) per year. According to the Environmental Protection Agency, this is the equivalent to 84,940 pounds of coal burned or 7,449 gallons of diesel consumed.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: REAP-MAND RENEW ENERGY SYSTEMS LOANS GUAR
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide permanent financing to Oxford Solar LLC to build a 2.4 Megatts of Direct Current (MW DC) ground-mounted solar project located in rural Oxford, Maine. The project has interconnection and net energy billing agreements in place with Central Maine Power Company, is expected to produce 3,323,490 kilowatt hours (kWh) of electricity in the first full year of operation, and will create three jobs at an average of $30/hour.

naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to complete necessary renovations and upgrades to the municipal complex for the Town of Norway. This applicant will be receiving $850,000 in Grant Funding under the Congressionally Directed Spending (CDS) Program which is being administered through the Rural Developments Community Facility Loan and Grant Program. This project will include the construction of a three bay, two story garage for police cruisers, which will allow adequate storage for cruisers to be kept under cover and ready to leave when necessary. The renovations and upgrades to the municipal complex will meet the needs of today and future needs for the town.
